agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_name: AREA 15 LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN - LAWRENCE COUNTY
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Lawrence County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- By phone or appointment only; offices currently closed to walk-ins due to pandemic.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Lawrence County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing recovery services in Lawrence County.
service_description: Offers one-on-one nonclinical services with a Certified Addictions Peer Recovery Coach to engage, educate, and support those working to sustain recovery from substance use. Coaches also provide guidance throughout the recovery process to aid clients in overcoming barriers, making informed decisions, and goalsetting. Services may complement, or be an alternative to, clinical treatment and other interventions.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. -- Walk-ins  welcome
site_eligibility: Individuals struggling with substance use or working to maintain sobriety

agency_desc: A nonprofit community organization that provides services to those in need. Services include early head start, head start, health clinic, Energy Assistance Program, weatherization, and small business loans.
site_name: PACE HEALTH CONNECTION CLINIC - LAWRENCE COUNTY
service_description: Provides access to reproductive health services, including physical exams, birth control, pregnancy testing and verification, Pap tests, testing and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases/infections, and HIV testing. Services for both men and women.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment -OR- walk in.
site_schedule: Mon 7:30am-noon and 1pm-5:30pm; Tues 8:30am-1pm and 2pm-6:30pm; Wed and Thurs 7:30am-noon and 1pm-5:30pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - LAWRENCE COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - LAWRENCE COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about civil matters and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to those who have been victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy services for victims of any crime. Gives victims the opportunity to complete a Victim Impact Statement to submit to prosecutors prior to sentencing or plea negotiations. Additional assistance provided to victims in the filing of protective orders, court accompaniment, crisis intervention, case management, protective order assistance, and mobile advocacy. Special emphasis placed on victims of domestic violence and/or sexual assault. Services may include safety planning and help applying for victims compensation benefits.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility:
○Living in Lawrence County 
○Victims of any crime

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing community-based, nonresidential services for those with disabilities.
service_name: SOUTHERN INDIANA CENTER FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING
service_description: Provides information, training, support, and advocacy to help those of any age with disabilities achieve independence. Individualized on-site or in-home training may include life skills, managing personal-care/homemaker assistants, using assistive technology, and exercising legal rights.
taxonomy_name: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
nameLevel4: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Experiencing a disability of any kind (or acting on behalf of someone with a disability)

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and donated clothing to people in need. Clothing is limited and sizes are not guaranteed.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Limit one visit every two weeks -- Must meet income guidelines.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a  thrift store where most everything is only a quarter so all God's children can have nice things.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry within the past 30 days

agency_name: INDIAN CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - LAWRENCE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: INDIAN CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - LAWRENCE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.  Also available: high dose flu vaccine for ages 65 and older and Flublok for people with an egg allergy.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 6 months and older -- High Dose Flu Vaccine for ages 65 and older and Flublok for people with an egg allergy

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers adult vaccinations, including Tetanus (Tdap), Hepatitis A, Hepatitis B, Shingles, Pneumonia, Prevnar, and Twinrix.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the county or for details about licensing or food safety programs.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, insured, or whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open-- Age 2 months through 18 years -- With or without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Bono, Marion, and Spice Valley Townships in Lawrence County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs 9am-8pm; Wed, Fri, Sat 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card, Public Library Access Card (PLAC), or Evergreen Card -- For a resident library card: Living in Bono, Marion, or Spice Valley Townships in Lawrence County

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Lawrence County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Lawrence County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Lawrence County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Choice Voucher Program in Lawrence County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. Persons already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list is currently closed. No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. -- Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Provides shelter for women and children who are experiencing homelessness.

site_eligibility: Women 18 years or older with or without children -- Residents must take a drug screen and remain drug and alcohol free -- Must actively seek employment during stay

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, anger management, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.
site_schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
